output.conclusion: By completing this course, you've gained a foundational understanding of Python for Data Science. You're now equipped to explore more advanced topics and apply your skills to real-world data analysis projects.
output.courseTitle: Python for Data Science: A Beginner's Guide
output.introduction: Welcome to the world of Data Science with Python! This course is designed for beginners with no prior programming experience. We'll cover the fundamentals of Python and its application in data analysis, visualization, and manipulation.

chapters.description: What is Python? Why use Python for Data Science? Setting up your Python environment (Anaconda installation).
Variables, data types (integers, floats, strings, booleans), operators, and basic input/output.
Conditional statements (if, else, elif) and loops (for, while).
Creating, accessing, and manipulating lists and tuples. Understanding mutability and immutability.
Creating, accessing, and modifying dictionaries. Key-value pairs and dictionary methods.
Defining and calling functions. Arguments, return values, and scope.
What is NumPy? Creating NumPy arrays. Basic array operations.
Accessing elements and subarrays. Boolean indexing.
Mathematical functions, statistical functions, and array manipulation functions.
What is Pandas? Series and DataFrames. Reading data from CSV files.
Selecting columns, rows, and subsets of data. Filtering data based on conditions.
Calculating descriptive statistics. Handling missing data.
